A **beholder**, e, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). The beholder is a [large](/wiki/Large "Large") [eye](/wiki/Eye_or_sphere "Eye or sphere") creature that is [amphibious](/wiki/Amphibious "Amphibious"), capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"), and can be seen via infravision.

A beholder has a passive gaze attack that [paralyzes](/wiki/Paralyze "Paralyze") the attacker, as well as two active [gaze attacks](/wiki/Gaze_attack "Gaze attack") that each use one of 16 random [damage types](/wiki/Damage_type "Damage type"): [death magic](/index.php?title=Death_magic\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Death magic (page does not exist)"), [cancellation](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation"), paralysis, [drain life](/wiki/Drain_life "Drain life"), [disenchantment](/index.php?title=AD_ENCH\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "AD ENCH (page does not exist)"), gradual [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"), [luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck")-draining, [confusion](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion"), [slowing](/wiki/Slowing "Slowing"), [stunning](/wiki/Stunning "Stunning"), [blinding](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire"), [cold](/wiki/Cold "Cold"), [shock](/wiki/Shock "Shock"), [hallucination](/wiki/Hallucination "Hallucination"), and [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep") - fire, cold and shock gazes each have a 2⁄19 chance of being selected per attack, while the other damage types each have a 1⁄19 chance of being selected. All of a beholder's gaze attacks are single-target. Beholders possess [fire resistance](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance"), [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance") and [shock resistance](/wiki/Shock_resistance "Shock resistance").

Beholders are [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to consume, but [eating](/wiki/Eat "Eat") a beholder's [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") or [quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") its [blood](/wiki/Potion_of_blood_\(dNetHack\) "Potion of blood (dNetHack)") has a 1⁄5 chance of granting [clairvoyance](/wiki/Clairvoyance "Clairvoyance") for 500–999 turns. Beholder corpses do not rot away or become tainted from age, and their blood can be used as a substitute for the [potion of enlightenment](/wiki/Potion_of_enlightenment "Potion of enlightenment") in [alchemy](/wiki/Alchemy "Alchemy").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly generated beholders are always created hostile, and are only randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"). They are not a valid form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph").

Hostile beholders may be generated as [minions](/wiki/Minion "Minion") of [Ver'tas](/index.php?title=Ver%27tas\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ver'tas (page does not exist)").

Beholders make up 1⁄10 of the monsters randomly generated on the Nightmare Temple levels of the [Chaos Temple Quest](/wiki/Chaos_Temple_Quest "Chaos Temple Quest"). Four beholders are randomly placed on each of the two Nightmare temple floors at level creation.

Beholders randomly generated outside the Chaos Temple Quest are always accompanied by four [gas spores](/wiki/Gas_spore "Gas spore").

## Strategy

Due to the chances of their active gaze attacks being immediately lethal, it is unwise to go near a beholder without [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") and a [blindfold](/wiki/Blindfold "Blindfold").

## Origin

The beholder is a well-known creature from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, and is one of the franchise's most iconic original creations. Beholders have spherical bodies with a single large eye, ten smaller eyes on stalks above it, and a mouth full of teeth. The smaller eyes are used for offense or defense; each one has a different magical ability. Beholders are typically hostile to other creatures, and often hostile to one another.

The quote in the encyclopedia entry is likely the genesis of the aphorism, ["beauty is in the eye of the beholder"](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eye_of_the_Beholder "wikipedia:Eye of the Beholder") - the encyclopedia entry for the beholder is a rephrasing of the aphorism.

## Encyclopedia entry

"Beauty in things exists merely in the mind which contemplates them."

\[ Moral and Political, by David Hume ]

A beholder, e, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. The beholder is a large eye creature that is amphibious, capable of flight, has infravision, and can be seen via infravision.

A beholder has a passive gaze attack that paralyzes the attacker, as well as two active gaze attacks that each use one of 16 random damage types: death magic, cancellation, paralysis, drain life, disenchantment, gradual stoning, luck-draining, confusion, slowing, stunning, blinding, fire, cold, shock, hallucination, and sleep - fire, cold and shock gazes each have a 2⁄19 chance of being selected per attack, while the other damage types each have a 1⁄19 chance of being selected. All of a beholder's gaze attacks are single-target. Beholders possess fire resistance, cold resistance and shock resistance.

Beholders are poisonous to consume, but eating a beholder's corpse or tin or quaffing its blood has a 1⁄5 chance of granting clairvoyance for 500–999 turns. Beholder corpses do not rot away or become tainted from age, and their blood can be used as a substitute for the potion of enlightenment in alchemy.

Generation

Randomly generated beholders are always created hostile, and are only randomly generated in Gehennom. They are not a valid form for polymorph.

Hostile beholders may be generated as minions of Ver'tas.

Beholders make up 1⁄10 of the monsters randomly generated on the Nightmare Temple levels of the Chaos Temple Quest. Four beholders are randomly placed on each of the two Nightmare temple floors at level creation.

Beholders randomly generated outside the Chaos Temple Quest are always accompanied by four gas spores.

Strategy

Due to the chances of their active gaze attacks being immediately lethal, it is unwise to go near a beholder without reflection and a blindfold.

Origin

The beholder is a well-known creature from Dungeons & Dragons, and is one of the franchise's most iconic original creations. Beholders have spherical bodies with a single large eye, ten smaller eyes on stalks above it, and a mouth full of teeth. The smaller eyes are used for offense or defense; each one has a different magical ability. Beholders are typically hostile to other creatures, and often hostile to one another.

The quote in the encyclopedia entry is likely the genesis of the aphorism, "beauty is in the eye of the beholder" - the encyclopedia entry for the beholder is a rephrasing of the aphorism.
